Here is a list of all files with brief descriptions:
ObjectAllocator.cpp [code]Brief
Contains definitions for an ObjectAllocator class, which allows users
to make use of a MemBlock system to allocate and deallocate data.
Also contains helper functions for the ObjectAllocator class

FUNCTION DEFINITIONS
([p] stands for private)
[Empty namespace] (For utility)
OffsetPtr => Offsets the given pointer by the bytes
CheckPattern => Returns whether bytes fit the pattern
[Header namespace] (For header stuff)
CreateMemBlockInfo => Creates dynamically allocated header
DestroyMemBlockInfo => Deletes above-mentioned header
GetAlloc => Returns ref. to allocation num
GetFlags => Returns ref to flag byte
GetMemBlockInfo => Returns ref to memblock pointer
GetUseCount => Returns ref to use count
GetUserDefined => Returns ref to user defined area start

ObjectAllocator class
PUBLIC FUNCTIONS
Allocate(const char*) => Passes the client a block of memory
Free(void*) => Frees allocated memory
DumpMemoryInUse(DUMPCALLBACK)=> Calls the fn for currently used blocks
ValidatePages(VALIDATECALLBACK)=> Calls the fn for potential corrupted
FreeEmptyPages() => Frees all empty pages
ImplementedExtraCredit() => Whether extra credit is implemented
SetDebugState(bool) => Sets the debugging mode
GetFreeList() => returns the free list
GetPageList() => returns the page list
GetConfig() => returns the configuration information
GetStats() => returns the stats
PRIVATE FUNCTIONS
(Exception checking functions)
[p]CheckInFreeList(GenericObject*)=> Error checks for multiple freeing
[p]CheckPadding(GenericObject*)=> Error checks the padding for corruption
[p]CheckOnBoundary(GenericObject*)=> Error checks for bad boundary access
(Header functions)
[p]GetDataPtr(GenericObject*) => Returns pointer to header's data
[p]GetFirstHeader(GenericObject*)=> Returns pointer to first header
[p]GetNextHeader(GenericObject*)=> Returns pointer to next header
(Page functions)
[p]AddPage() => Adds a new page to the pageList
[p]FreePage(GenericObject*) => Frees the page
[p]GetPageSize(size_t,OAConfig&)=> Returns the size of a page
[p]IsEmptyPage_Header(GenericObject*)=> Returns whether page is empty
[p]IsEmptyPage_NoHeader(GenericObject*)=> Returns whether page is empty
(Data block functions)
[p]PopFront() => Pops from the free list
[p]PushFront(GenericObject*) => Pushes onto the free list
Specific portions that gave you the most trouble: Typing out all the functions. It was alot of it
ObjectAllocator.h [code]Brief
Contains declarations for an ObjectAllocator class, which allows users
to make use of a MemBlock system to allocate and deallocate data.
Also contains other structs which interact with the ObjectAllocator class

INTERFACE

Static variables
DEFAULT_OBJECTS_PER_PAGE => The default objects per page
DEFAULT_MAX_PAGES => The default maximum pages

OAException
Enums
OA_Exception => Exceptions for the ObjectAllocator
Functions
code => Returns the exception code
what => Returns information about the throw

OAConfig
Static Variables
BASIC_HEADER_SIZE => Basic header's size
EXTERNAL_HEADER_SIZE => External header's size
Enums
HBLOCK_TYPE => Types of header blocks
Variables
UseCPPMemManager_ => by-pass the functionality of the OA
ObjectsPerPage_ => number of objects on each page
MaxPages_ => maximum number of pages OA can allocate
DebugOn_ => enable/disable debugging code
PadBytes_ => size of the left/right padding perblock
HBlockInfo_ => size of the header for each block
Alignment_ => address alignment of each block
LeftAlignSize_ => number of bytes to align first blk
InterAlignSize_ => number of bytes between remaining
Subclasses
HeaderBlockInfo => Contains info about the header

OAStats
Variables
ObjectSize_ => size of each object
PageSize_ => size of a page
FreeObjects_ => number of objects on the free list
ObjectsInUse_ => number of objects in use by client
PagesInUse_ => number of pages allocated
MostObjects_ => most objects in use by client
Allocations_ => total requests to allocate memory
Deallocations_ => total requests to free memory

MemBlockInfo
Variables
in_use => Is the block free or in use?
alloc_num => The allocation number (count) of this
label => A dynamically allocated c-style string

ObjectAllocator
Static Variables
UNALLOCATED_PATTERN => Unallocated pattern
ALLOCATED_PATTERN => Allocated pattern
FREED_PATTERN => Freed pattern
PAD_PATTERN => Padding pattern
ALIGN_PATTERN => Alignment pattern
Functions
Allocate(const char*) => Passes the client a block of memory
Free(void*) => Frees allocated memory
DumpMemoryInUse(DUMPCALLBACK)=> Calls the fn for currently used blocks
ValidatePages(VALIDATECALLBACK)=> Calls the fn for potential corrupted
FreeEmptyPages() => Frees all empty pages
ImplementedExtraCredit() => Whether extra credit is implemented
SetDebugState(bool) => Sets the debugging mode
GetFreeList() => returns the free list
GetPageList() => returns the page list

GetStats() => returns the stats
